@EntryRoot=	HELL

===================================================
@EntryRoot=	HELL
@FullHeader=	In the R. V. of O. T. it appears only in
@References=	Isa 5:14; 14:9,15; 28:15,18; 57:9; Eze 31:16,17; 32:21,27; Am 9:2; Jon 2:2; Hab 2:5 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	HELL
@FullHeader=	In the R. V., "sheol" is translated "lowest pit"
@References=	De 32:22; Ps 86:13 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	HELL
@FullHeader=	And it is translated "pit" in
@References=	Ps 55:15 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	HELL
@FullHeader=	In the R. V. the word "Sheol" itself occurs in the following scriptures
@References=	2Sa 22:6; Job 11:8; 26:6; Ps 9:17; 16:10; 18:5; 116:3; 139:8; Pr 5:5; 7:27; 9:18; 15:11,24; 23:14; 27:20 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	HELL
@FullHeader=	"Sheol" is translated "grave" in A. V. in
@References=	Ge 37:35; 42:38; 44:29,31; 1Sa 2:6; 1Ki 2:6; 1Ki 9; Job 7:9; 14:13; 17:13; 21:13; 24:19; Ps 6:5; 30:3; 31:17; 49:14,15; 88:3; 89:48; 141:7; Pr 1:12; 30:16; Ec 9:10; So 8:6; Ho 13:14 
===================================================

===================================================
@EntryRoot=	ISRAEL, PROPHECIES CONCERNING
@FullHeader=	(For the history of the above kings see under each name) - Josiah is succeeded by Jehoahaz, who reigned for three months, was dethroned by the king of Egypt, and the land was put under taxation
@References=	2Ki 23:30-35; 2Ch 36:1-3 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	ISRAEL, PROPHECIES CONCERNING

===================================================

===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	SYMBOLS USED IN
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	ALAMOTH - (Literally virgins)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	ALAMOTH - A musical term which appears in
@References=	1Ch 15:20 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	ALAMOTH - And in the title of
@References=	Ps 46:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	ALAMOTH - (It seems to indicate the rendering of the song by female voices, possibly soprano)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	AL-TASCHITH - It appears in the titles of
@References=	Ps 57:1; 58:1; 59:1; 75:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	AL-TASCHITH - (it seems to have been used to indicate the kind of ode, or the kind of melody in which the ode should be sung.)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	HIGGAION - (According to Gesenius, it signifies the murmuring tone of a harp, and hence that the music should be rendered in a plaintive manner.)
@References=	Ps 9:16 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	HIGGAION - (Combined with "Selah," it may have been intended to indicate a pause in the vocal music while the instruments rendered an interlude.)
@References=	Ps 19:14 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	HIGGAION - (Mendelssohn translates it "meditation, thought." Hence, the music was to be rendered in a mode to promote devout meditation.)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	MAKALATH, MASCHIL, LEANNOTH - These terms are found in the titles of
@References=	Ps 53:1; 88:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	MAKALATH, MASCHIL, LEANNOTH - (Authorities grope in darkness as to their signification. They may indicate the instruments to be played, or the melody to be sung)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	MASCHIL - This musical sign occurs in the titles of
@References=	Ps 32:1; 42:1; 44:1; 45:1; 52:1; 53:1; 54:1; 55:1; 74:1; 78:1; 88:1; 89:1; 142:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	MASCHIL - (The meaning is obscure. But its signification where it occurs elsewhere than in the titles of Psalms is equivalent to the English word "instruction," or to become wise by instruction; hence, Ps 47:7: "Sing ye praises with understanding.")
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	MICAHTAM - A musical term in the titles of
@References=	Ps 16:1; 56:1; 57:1; 58:1; 59:1; 60:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	MICAHTAM - (Luther interprets this as "golden," that is, "precious." Ewald interprets it as signifying a plaintive manner.)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	MUTH-LABBEN - In the title of
@References=	Ps 9:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	MUTH-LABBEN - (Authorities, ancient and modern, differ as to the probable signification. Gesenius and De Wette interpret it, "with the voice of virgins, by boys." Others derive the word from a different Hebrew root, and interpret it as indicating that the Psalm was a funeral ode.)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	NEGINAH and NEGINOTH - Appear in the titles of
@References=	Ps 4:1; 54:1; 55:1; 61:1; 67:1; Hab 3:19 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	NEGINAH and NEGINOTH - (Its use seems to have been to indicate that the song should be accompanied by stringed instruments.)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	NEHILOTH - Appears in the title of
@References=	Ps 5:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	NEHILOTH - (It seems to indicate, according to Gesenius, that when this Psalm was sung it was to be accompanied by wind instruments.)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	SELAH - (This term appears frequently in the Psalms. Its use is not known. Possibly it signified a pause in the vocal music while an instrumental interlude or finale was rendered.)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	SHEMINITH - In the titles of
@References=	Ps 6:1; 12:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	SHEMINITH - (Translated "eighth," probably indicates the measure, movement, or pitch.)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	SHIGGAION - In the title of
@References=	Ps 7:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	SHIGGAION - And its plural, SHIGIONOTH, in the title of
@References=	Hab 3:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	SHIGGAION - (Supposed to be a musical term to guide in rendering the song. At the close of the chapter, the author refers the ode "to the chief musician, on my stringed instruments." The term may suggest the movement in interpreting the music set to it.)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	SHOSHANNIM and SHUSHAN-EDUTH - In the titles to
@References=	Ps 45:1; 60:1; 69:1; 80:1 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC
@FullHeader=	SHOSHANNIM and SHUSHAN-EDUTH - (Seems to indicate the manner in which these Psalms were to be rendered. Kimchi, Tremellius, and Eichhorn render it "hexachorda," that is, that in singing these Psalms instruments of six strings were to accompany.)
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	MUSIC

@EntryRoot=	PAUL
@FullHeader=	Reasons in the synagogue every Sabbath; is rejected by the Jews; turns to the Gentiles; makes his home with Justus; continues there for eighteen months, teaching the word of God

===================================================
@EntryRoot=	PAUL
@FullHeader=	Persecuted by Jews, drawn before the deputy, charged with wicked lewdness; accusation dismissed; takes his leave after many days, and sails to Syria, accompanied by Aquila and Priscilla
@References=	Ac 18:12-18 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	PAUL
@FullHeader=	Visits Ephesus, where he leaves Aquila and Priscilla; enters into a synagogue, where he reasons with the Jews; starts on his return trip to Jerusalem; visits Caesarea; crosses over the country of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening the disciples
@References=	Ac 18:18-23 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	PAUL
@FullHeader=	Returns to Ephesus; immerses in the name of the Lord Jesus, and lays his hands upon the disciples, who are baptized with the Holy Spirit; preaches in the synagogue; remains in Ephesus for two years; heals the sick people
@References=	Ac 19:12 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	PAUL
@FullHeader=	Rebukes the exorcists; casts an evil spirit out of a man, and many believe, bringing their evil books of sorcery to be burned

@EntryRoot=	PAUL
@FullHeader=	Sends Timothy and Erastus into Macedonia, but he himself remains in Asia for a period of time
@References=	Ac 19:21,22 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	PAUL
@FullHeader=	The spread of the gospel through his preaching interferes with the makers of idols; he is persecuted, and a great uproar of the city is created; the town clerk appeases the people; dismisses the accusation against Paul, and disperses the people
@References=	Ac 19:23-41; 2Co 1:8; 2Ti 4:14 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	PAUL
@FullHeader=	Proceeds to Macedonia after strengthening the congregations in that region; comes into Greece and lives for three months; returns through Macedonia, accompanied by Sopater, Aristarchus, Secundus, Gaius, Timothy, Tychicus, and Trophimus

@EntryRoot=	POUND
@FullHeader=	The Hebrew word "maneh" is translated "pound,"
@References=	1Ki 10:17; Ezr 2:69; Ne 7:71,72 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	POUND
@FullHeader=	And is equivalent to almost one pound (fourteen ounces)
===================================================

@FullHeader=	In John the weight was equivalent to about twelve ounces
@References=	Joh 12:3 
===================================================
@EntryRoot=	POUND
@FullHeader=	In Luke the Greek word "mina" is translated "pound," and worth approximately one-hundred denarii (more than three months' wages)
@References=	Lu 19:13-25

@EntryRoot=	QUOTATIONS AND ALLUSIONS
@FullHeader=	IN THE NEW TESTAMENT FROM, AND TO, THE OLD TESTAMENT
@References=	Mt 1:23; with Isa 7:14 Mt 2:6; with Mic 5:2 Mt 2:15; with Ho 11:1 Mt 2:18; with Jer 31:15 Mt 3:3; with Isa 40:3 Mt 4:4; with De 8:3 Mt 4:6; with Ps 91:11,12 Mt 4:7; with De 6:16 Mt 4:10; with De 6:13; 10:20 Mt 4:15,16; with Isa 9:1,2; 42:7 Mt 5:21; with Ex 20:13; De 5:17 Mt 5:27; with Ex 20:14; De 5:18 Mt 5:31; with De 24:1 Mt 5:33; with Ex 20:7; Le 19:12; De 5:11 Mt 5:38; with Ex 21:24 Mt 7:23; with Ps 6:8 Mt 8:17; with Isa 53:4 Mt 9:13; with Ho 6:6 Mt 11:10; with Mal 3:1 Mt 12:7; with Hos 6:6 Mt 12:17-21; with Isa 42:1-4 Mt 13:14,15; with Isa 6:9,10 Mt 13:35; with Ps 78:2 Mt 15:4; with Ex 20:12; 21:17 Mt 15:7-9; with Isa 29:13 Mt 19:4; with Ge 1:27; 2:24 Mt 19:18,19; with Ex 20:12-16 Mt 21:5; with Zec 9:9 Mt 21:9; with Ps 118:26 Mt 21:13; with Isa 56:7; Jer 7:11 Mt 21:16; with Ps 8:2 Mt 21:42; with Ps 118:22,23 Mt 22:24; with De 25:5 Mt 22:32; with Ex 3:6 Mt 22:37; with De 6:5 Mt 22:38,39; with Le 19:18 Mt 22:39; with Ex 20:12-16 Mt 22:44; with Ps 110:1 Mt 23:39; with Ps 118:26 Mt 26:31; with Zec 13:7 Mt 27:9,10; with Zec 11:12,13 Mt 27:35; with Ps 22:18 Mt 27:46; with Ps 22:1 Mr 1:2; with Mal 3:1 Mr 1:3; with Isa 40:3 Mr 4:12; with Isa 6:9,10 Mr 7:6,7; with Isa 29:13 Mr 7:10; with Ex 20:12; 21:17 Mr 9:44; with Isa 66:24 Mr 10:6; with Ge 1:27 Mr 10:7,8; with Ge 2:24 Mr 10:19; with Ex 20:12-17 Mr 11:9; with Ps 118:26 Mr 11:17; with Isa 56:7; Jer 7:11 Mr 12:10; with Ps 118:22,23 Mr 12:19; with De 25:5 Mr 12:26; with Ex 3:6 Mr 12:29; with De 6:4 Mr 12:30; with De 6:5 Mr 12:31; with Le 19:18 Mr 12:36; with Ps 110:1 Mr 14:27; with Zec 13:7 Mr 15:28; with Isa 53:12 Mr 15:34; with Ps 22:1 Lu 1:17; with Mal 4:6 Lu 2:23; with Ex 13:2,12 Lu 2:24; with Le 12:8 Lu 2:32; with Isa 9:1,2; 42:7 Lu 3:4-6; with Isa 40:3-5 Lu 4:4; with De 8:3 Lu 4:8; with De 6:13; 10:20 Lu 4:10,11; with Ps 91:11,12 Lu 4:12; with De 6:16 Lu 4:18,19; with Isa 61:1,2 Lu 7:27; with Mal 3:1 Lu 8:10; with Isa 6:9 Lu 10:27; with Le 19:18 Lu 13:35; with Ps 118:26 Lu 18:20; with Ex 20:12-16 Lu 19:46; with Isa 56:7; Jer 7:11 Lu 20:17; with Ps 118:22,23 Lu 20:37; with Ex 3:6 Lu 20:42,43; with Ps 110:1 Lu 22:37; with Isa 53:12 Lu 23:30; with Ho 10:8 Lu 23:46; with Ps 31:5 Joh 1:23; with Isa 40:3 Joh 2:17; with Ps 69:9 Joh 6:31; with Ps 78:24 Joh 6:45; with Isa 54:13 Joh 7:38; with Pr 18:4;
